answers.answer: I think its the safest in your situation. You're baby will have an excellent chance of survival and you dont want to put yourself at higher risk waiting any longer.

Yes it's fine. Your doc won't induce you unless they think Its best for you and baby. 37W is term so your pretty close! Also if there is a concern you doc will or would have talked to you about steroids to help make sure the babies lungs are developed enough. If the baby is under 5lbs the baby might have to stay in the nicu for a couple days. But viable wise you shouldn't have an issues at 36w unless there is an underlying health condition.

I'm in the same situation but we are going to deliver at 37 weeks which happens to be the week before Christmas. They would deliver at 36 weeks if they had to but they want to wait as long as possible. Every week in the womb is better for the baby unless medically they see a reason to deliver sooner.

question: I'm 26 weeks pregnant and I have high blood pressure and gestional diabetes and my baby is very small my Doctor is saying, and she wants to induce me at 36 weeks. Is this safe?
title: induction
